content:
H. Reichardt said
That's why I suggested an enhancement request...

The people who answer questions here, for the most part, are other users volunteering their time (like me), not employees or developers. If you want to leave feedback for developers, you can go to the Thunderbird Help menu and select Share ideas and feedback…. Alternatively, you can use this link. Your feedback gets collected by a team of people who read it and gather data about the most common issues.

You can also file a bug report or feature request. See File a bug report or feature request for Mozilla products for details.

content:
To be honest, I would suggest you look at the ical files containing the invitations (crtl+U) will give access to the message source. Are the UTC offsets in the calendar invite correctly set for the expected time an date?

I would suspect at least someone is setting the time on their computer and not the UTC offset or timezone correctly, depending on which operating system they use.

The 40 minutes however is very odd. That sounds like the time is set on the server but the timezone is not correct, except 40 minutes does not equate to any timezone "change" I am aware of. while there are a number of time zones that are on the 30 and 45 minute mark 40 is an oddity.

Could this be an issue arising from changes in base calendar from gregorian to another and back again? I do not claim any sort of expertise, but I think if it is a bug it needs to be isolated as to cause and at this point we have nothing.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
It looks to me your site is hosted on ionos.es, and if that's the case, they recommend different settings.

incoming POP server: pop.ionos.es on 995, SSL/TLS, normal password, User Name = email address

incoming IMAP server: imap.ionos.es on 993, SSL/TLS, normal password, User Name = email address

outgoing SMTP server: smtp.ionos.es on 465, SSL/TLS, normal password, User Name = email address

content:
Well, I think you may be able to achieve your objective with favorite folders. That is, from folder mode menu, tick 'favorite folders' and that will add that category in left sidebar. Then, rightclick your important folders and tick 'favorite folder' and you will then have all your priority folders readily presented.

For profile switching, it's rather simple (in my opinion), considering that TB needs to restart to administer a different profile. Maybe the menu is misnamed (?) for that? For example, to create a new profile, the steps are to click help>troubleshooting, scroll to 'profiles', click 'about:profiles' and click 'create profile' button, which lets you name the profile and define where it is to be located. Then, in future, by clicking help>troubleshooting and returning to that about:profiles link, you can pick which profile to open. I agree it isn't a simple menu link, but does work rather well. Another option that I like is to set another shortcut on desktop, with each shortcut invoking a different profile.

And we love you too. Thank you for your support.

content:
Not possible to use a folder which acts as a header to section mail accounts that exist as separate mail accounts. Mail accounts are independent accounts.

One IDEA that may work for you - read on.... There is One method you could consider if you are using only POP mail accounts for eg: parents Only pop accounts can be merged to use one mail account - eg: Local folders mail account. It's called a Global Inbox.

  • https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/unify-your-pop-email-accounts-global-inbox
  • http://kb.mozillazine.org/Global_Inbox

In 'Account Settings' you will still see the list of separate accounts. But in Folder Pane, you will not see them. You do not see the separate account names as all pop accounts come in to the one Local Folders 'Inbox'. Those pop accounts will use 'Local Folders' as their 'group' mail account. But there is nothing stopping you from creating a sort of likeness to a mail account. In 'Local Folders' mail account, you can create a new folder which has the account name or name of parent. It can contain subfolders like it's own Inbox. You can set up message filters to scan the 'TO', 'Cc', 'Bcc' and IF matches parent A email address put in folder X You can even rename 'Local Folders' mail account to say 'Parent Accounts'. So it is possible to set up a Group like organisation using the 'Local Folders' mail account - BUT it can only be done using POP mail accounts.

If using IMAP or a mix or you like to separate groups completely: Setting up a 'profile' to act as a group for certain mail accounts is the natural way to organize groups of accounts if you do not want to clutter up the Folder Pane of one profile.

If I want to open a different profile then you have a couple of options - (other than the addon mentioned previously). In no particular order of preference.

Method 1: From within Thunderbird

  • Help > TRoubleshooting Information
  • Under 'Application Basics' section near the bottom - Profiles - click on 'about:profiles'
  • This opens in a new tab and you can keep it open if desired.
  • Each profile will be listed and there is a 'Launch profile' button which you can use to open the desired profile.
  • Click on the relevant 'Launch Profile' button and it opens Thunderbird in a new window using that profile.
  • Close the original Thunderbird window.

Method 2: Create a shortcut icon on the desktop to prompt the Profile Manager to open so you can choose. Note: that shortcut icon will only work if you have exited Thunderbird first.

  • Create a shortcut icon for Thunderbird and put on desktop then do this:
  • Right click on the Thunderbird shortcut icon and select 'Properties'
  • In the section where it says 'Target:'
  • It will say something like this: "C:\Program Files\Mozilla Thunderbird\thunderbird.exe"
  • At the end of that line you need: a space and then type -P
  • So it looks like this: "C:\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Thunderbird\thunderbird.exe" -P
  • click on 'Apply'
  • Click on 'OK'
  • This shortcut will now open the 'Profile Manager' - you could rename the Shortcut to say 'Thunderbird Profile Manager'

You can use it to Create a new profile Or select which profile you want to open

If you do not want Thunderbird to auto open on a particular default at start up then uncheck that option.

creator: S4S4

content:
It sounds like you do not use POP accounts so setting up a grouping system using folders and filters would not be possible.

Any mail account whether it's in the Folder Pane or displaying in the 'Favourites' section can be collapsed down to just the account name, so none of it's actual folders are displaying. There is a V chevron icon to the left of the account name folder - click on it and it collapses all the folders, so you just have an account name displaying. It saves a lot of space and declutters the view when not dealing with those mail accounts.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
re :easier way to switch profiles

There is always the addon which can help but even without it.

Using 'about: profiles' which you open in tab and keep open. In what way is the following difficult or clunky:

  1. click the pre opened 'about:profile' tab
  2. click on 'Launch Profile' of suitable profile
  3. Exit the original window

Only 3 clicks.

You just need to get that 'about:profile' tab opened up and then when you close Thunderbird, the session should remember it is an opened tab, so next time you use that profile it is already open and ready for use when you need it.

Or use the Profile Manager shortcut.

  1. Exit Thunderbird
  2. Click on shortcut
  3. select profile
  4. click on Start Thunderbird

Only 4 clicks
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
first install the latest version your distro has. Thunderbird in recent years has become increasingly pedantic about what version you were previously using the profile with and older profiles just do not have the information for the import for barf on. It it even thinks the current version is a different bit version or numerically version it will jack up and refuse the profile as "unsuitable" as it has been used on a higher version.

This can be overridden when using the profile by is using the --allow-downgrade command line parameter when starting Thunderbird. But I honestly have no idea what goes on inside the profile import.

BTW my preferred "move" approach is create a new profile in Thunderbird and upon it in file manager and copy the entire contents of the old folder into the new one, replacing anything new generally this "just works" Perhaps it may be a solution here, as you should only need access to the old folder.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
What do you mean by 'summary box' ?

Thunderbird mail account accounts and folders are in 'Folder Pane' A selected folder displays the list of emails in the 'Message List' also known as 'Thread Pane' A selected email displays an opened email headers in 'Message Header' A selected email displays an opened email in the 'Message Pane'

What do you mean by 'difficult to read' ? Is the font too small ?

  • Via 'Menu Bar' toolbar - 'View' > 'Font Size' > click on 'increase font size'
  • Via 'Menu app 3 lines icon - 'Menu app icon' > 'Font Size' > click on the + icon to increase font size.

Are lines too close together in Folder Pane, Menus and Message List:

  • Via 'Menu Bar' toolbar - 'View' > 'Density' > click on an option 'Compact' has least spacing - 'Relaxed' has most spacing
  • Via 'Menu app 3 lines icon - 'Menu app icon' > 'Density' > 3 icons 'Compact, Default and Relaxed' - click on icon

content:
bcorston said
I import my local folders from my NAS unit, My Documents/mail. The folder headings are all there, but there is no content when I click on the headings? This does not happen in the windows 10 version?

Yes. Thunderbird stores many paths internally and absolutely which means there are problems converting between Linux and Windows as paths a described differently.

The best I can suggest to keep deleting the foldertree.json file and forces a rebuild of the folders pane on startup. It will delay load at the entire path to all o the folders will have to be traversed on startup, but it should fix the immediate issue.

BTW if you have an antivirus on Windows that can scan the my documents folder access requests, you will probably see data corruption over time unless you isolate the Thunderbird data and exempt the files from on access scanning.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
l'd suggest you raise the issue in the share ideas and feedback location on the help menu. It leads to this location https://connect.mozilla.org/

content:
My person view is the profile import and export is fundamentally broken. It languished for a whole year preferenced off because they chose a zip library that could only zip files of 2Gb and few have a profile that small any longer with 15Gb gmail accounts proliferating. Even if it works as they intend you don't get any of the passwords or certificates the old way of copy and paste delivered.

My recommendation is open your new Thunderbird, open the troubleshooting information on the help menu an click the show profile button. Close Thunderbird Take your old profile folder contents and paste it into the new profile folder Restart Thunderbird and everything should be good.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
You can synchronize a google address book with Thunderbird. But it does not replace the built in one, it is supplemental to it.

Use the down arrow beside the "new address book" button to add a carddav address book. Enter your gmail email address when prompted for the username (most usernames at google are the email address) leave the location blank and you will be prompted to log into google if that is necessary and then offered address books if there is more than one.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
silcf said
Thunderbird Tools menu has Run Filter on Folders and Delete Mail Marked as Junk greyed out.

Thunderbird's menu is context sensitive so unless you see folders below all the mail type functions like run filters are disabled.

1. Several folders and their subfolders and emails have vanished.

That can occur when the folder tree.json file has issues and deleting it from the profile folder with Thunderbird not running will often fix the issue. However in the case of IMAP accounts folder for account that are not accepting connections also disappear until they can be reinitialized from the servers canonical store.

2. None of the message filters that were working are working. Yes the fileres are enabled checked and "Run selected filter(s) on:" is set to the inbox connected to my email address.

What does your filter log show when you select run now?

3. The Tools-> Run Filter on Folders is greyed out 4. The Tools-> Delete Mail Marked as Junk is greyed out

See my initial comments <blockquyote> I have seached the web for help and I have looked for settings that may need to be checked or set but have found nothing that helped. </blockquote>

The following is fairly normal standard diagnostic steps, other than the request for information. But if your situation is sort of randomly messed up it does sound like an antivirus toolbar might be behind the issues. They think they can write code for Thunderbird and force feed it, but it is rarely compatible for more than one version

Could you please do the following?

  1. Open the menu > Help > Troubleshooting Information, then click Copy text to Clipboard.
  2. Go to https://pastebin.mozilla.org/, paste the clipboard by right clicking in the large text area, select paste from the menu, change the retention period to expire in 28 days, use the Paste Snippet button to create a page containing your info, then copy the resulting URL (address) of the page created.
  3. Open a reply to this post, and paste the URL to your troubleshooting information you just copied.
  4. Please also provide results for the following test on your system
    • Does Thunderbird work as expected in Thunderbird troubleshooting mode?
    • Does Thunderbird work as expected with your OS started in safe mode with Networking. Instructions for each operating system: Windows 10/11, Windows 8, Windows 7, OSX
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
URL https://pastebin.mozilla.org/XtsbDhcs

FYI: I also use Mawarebytes Premium 4.6.5 to periodically run a scan. I

After going into troubleshooting mode and coming back out, filters are working as is the delete Junk.

However, the missing folders are still missing.
creator: silcf

content:
silcf said
However, the missing folders are still missing.

As you accounts are POP accounts, use the troubleshooting information to open the profile folder. Close Thunderbird In the file manager widow that opened to the profile folder content, locate and delete foldertree.json and restart Thunderbird.

That files is essentially a cache of the tree of folders on the left. Deleting it forces Thunderbird to go look on the hard disk and find then all over again so it will slow the startup the first time. But it is usually a sure fire cure for those computer glitches that just make no sense.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
I figured out the problem. This setting only changes the sync preference on startup and when manual sync is activated. It has no effect on notifications for folders when email is received when thunderbird is opened. So with this setting unchecked, I still get notified when mail is received in that folder when thunderbird is running, but not when the email was delivered prior to the client being opened.

Still not ideal but I guess it works.

content:
I do not get blue dots for Events. I get blue dots for Tasks.

According to info in Article:

  • https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/new-thunderbird-115-supernova

Dates with an event or task are now marked with a blue dot to allow easier scanning without relying on color.

Personally, I'm not so keen to have a mini calendar filled up with dots.

Please check - are the dots on your system being shown for both Tasks and Events hence why you seem to have them every day?
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Thanks for the info about dots applying to both events and tasks. I thought they were only shown for events.

Having said that, I don't have a lot of events or tasks scheduled. For the current month, there are only 11 days on which I have events or tasks scheduled, but every day has a dot. I wish there were some way to determine exactly which tasks or events were triggering the dots.

A whole calendar filled with dots is useless and annoying. I think there might be some way to suppress them entirely, but I find it useful to see at a glance the dates on which I have events scheduled. I'd rather not see dots for dates on which I have tasks scheduled, but I could live with that.

content:
There are two types of passwords. A primary or master password which is used to lock Thunderbird account password store, and account passwords.

If you are needing to reset the primary password these instructions will do it, they will also remove any stored passwords if there is a primary password set. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/protect-your-thunderbird-passwords-primary-password#w_removing-your-primary-password

If it is an account password, Thunderbird has only ever stored what you gave it to store. If you no longer know that password you will need to contact the relevant mail provider to have the account password reset.

Please note that post update we often see folks with antivirus products that have lost the plot and can not longer access their mail because the antivirus software is actively blocking them. But as you say this is following a "desktop reset" whatever that is, I guess update issues are not pertinent
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Matt said
As a profile folder does not have a userchoromes file or folder by default, where did you find it?

Thanks for your reply.

In the profile folder, in chrome/userChrome.css.

The CSS code in question removes buttons from the message display header that duplicate buttons in the Mail Toolbar. BUT... In Thunderbird vers. 115, the Mail Toolbar is missing Reply, Forward, etc. – and it can't be customized to include them.

So, looks like maybe that userChrome.css is something I set up a LONG time ago. Probably a great many users did the same thing... to remove the duplicate buttons.

Has a bug report been filed re: the toolbar problem?
